entries.title: Prince Harry's makes new revelations in memoir
entries.description: The memoir is the latest in a string of public revelations and accusations by Harry and Meghan that have shaken Britain's royal family.

entries.title: Two-thirds of glaciers on track to disappear by 2100 according to new study
entries.description: 'For many small glaciers it is too late,' said study co-author Regine Hock of the study published Thursday in 'Science.'

entries.title: Mexico: A bloody jailbreak in Ciudad Juarez opens the debate on the president's security policy
entries.description: Twenty-five members of the Sinaloa cartel escaped on January 1, 2023, including one of the criminal gang's leaders. Two days earlier, President López Obrador congratulated himself on the country's decline in violence.

entries.title: While the US economy is struggling to recruit, Big Tech is laying off
entries.description: The sector's setbacks contrast with the rest of the US economy, which, despite inflation and tighter monetary policy, is running at full steam, writes columnist Philippe Escande.

entries.title: In Australia, no mercy for climate activists
entries.description: A number of Australian states have adopted a repressive legal arsenal to threaten the right to protest. Environmental activists have been jailed while the country suffers the effects of climate change.

entries.title: US House: McCarthy fails to win speakership in 7th vote
entries.description: The House of Representatives still does not have a new speaker as a group of Republicans continued to vote against the party's leader.

entries.title: Funeral of Benedict XVI: A restrained ceremony before tens of thousands of faithful
entries.description: Presiding over the ceremony in St. Peter's Square, Francis paid tribute to the 'wisdom' of the pope emeritus, whose funeral attracted a much smaller crowd than that of his predecessor, John Paul II.

entries.title: French pension reform: Unions are united and 'preparing for protests'
entries.description: After three months of talks with the government, union leaders are still firmly opposed to the reform project.

entries.title: French finance minister mulls 'green industry' law
entries.description: Bruno Le Maore is to present a new bill in the coming days aiming at making France a 'leading decarbonized nation' in Europe.

entries.title: Putin orders Russian forces to observe 36-hour Ukraine ceasefire to mark Orthodox Christmas
entries.description: Ukraine responded on Thursday by calling the Russian ceasefire declaration 'hypocrisy' and 'propaganda'.

entries.title: Environmental crimes are on the rise as offenses diversify
entries.description: In a report released last month, a French agency in charge of tackling environmental infractions highlighted obstacles to combating such crimes.

entries.title: EU attempts to coordinate Covid-19 approach for travelers from China
entries.description: Member states have opted for a coordinated approach to the Covid-19 surge in China and mandatory tests before take-off will be 'strongly encouraged,' amid fears of a new variant.

entries.title: Republican Party crisis continues at US House of Representatives
entries.description: For the second day in a row, Kevin McCarthy failed to unite the party and be elected Speaker of the House.

entries.title: The teachers who won't give up: 'Helping pupils to become citizens is the greatest victory'
entries.description: An increasing number of teachers in France get tired of their profession. Yet, some who still hold on to their jobs told 'Le Monde' of their motivations.

entries.title: WTO in crisis: Regulated globalization at risk after war, pandemic
entries.description: Faced with growing confrontations between the US and China, the body that regulates international trade is gradually being paralyzed. In the context of the war in Ukraine, the European bloc is reevaluating its choices.

entries.title: Trial begins for Belarus Nobel Prize winner Bialiatski
entries.description: The human rights activist and opponent of the Lukashenko regime has been a political prisoner in Minsk since 2021.

entries.title: Lazio fans hurl racist abuse at tearful Umtiti in Italy
entries.description: The Cameroon-born defender, who won the 2018 World Cup with France, was the primary target of abuse by Lazio fans in Italy.

entries.title: In Senegal, press organizations demand the immediate release of journalist Pape Alé Niang
entries.description: The Dakar judiciary has again rejected the request for the provisional release of the investigative journalist, who is very weakened by hunger strike.

entries.title: Erdogan asks Putin to declare 'unilateral' Ukraine ceasefire
entries.description: The Turkish and Russian leaders held a telephone conversation to discuss recent developments in Ukraine.

entries.title: Mired in social crisis, UK PM Rishi Sunak tries to get back on track
entries.description: The British prime minister made five promises in his first policy speech, including reducing health service waiting lists.

entries.title: Iran closes French institute in response to 'Charlie Hebdo' Khamenei cartoons
entries.description: The satirical magazine published dozens of cartoons picturing Iran's supreme leader earlier this week as part of a competition to support anti-government protests in Iran.

entries.title: Is Covid-19 testing of travelers from China justified?
entries.description: Several countries have taken measures to screen passengers arriving from China. The measures were first described as 'unjustified' by the European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control, but a meeting of governments 'strongly encouraged' testing.

entries.title: Thousands attend funeral of Benedict XVI in Rome
entries.description: Joseph Ratzinger died on December 31, 2022, aged 95.

entries.title: Conservative Catholics unite to mourn Pope Emeritus Benedict XVI
entries.description: Since he was not the reigning pope at the time of his death, some small changes will be made to the funeral of Pope Emeritus Benedict XVI, and it is not a State event.

entries.title: By abolishing the monarchy, Barbados has 'broken a lock' in the Caribbean
entries.description: Since the accession of King Charles III to the throne, several Commonwealth kingdoms have been considering following the lead set by Barbados in November 2021 and breaking away from the British crown.

entries.title: Evacuations ordered as California storm knocks out power
entries.description: Evacuations were ordered across northern California after the new storm left more than 100,000 customers in the San Francisco Bay Area and the Central Coast without power.

entries.title: Fay Weldon, 'The Life and Loves of a She-Devil' author, dies aged 91
entries.description: The author published more than 30 novels across her career, as well as collections of short stories, films for television, and pieces of journalism.

entries.title: 'Romeo and Juliet' child actors sue over 1968 nude scene
entries.description: Olivia Hussey and Leonard Whiting claim the film's director cajoled them into performing the scene.

entries.title: 'The Chinese Communist Party is on the verge of turning today's China into yesterday's Soviet Union'
entries.description: The resumption of the Chinese economy by the Communist Party confronts the country with the same obstacles that brought down the USSR at the end of the 1980s, analyze the two economists Di Guo and Chenggang Xu, in an article in "Le Monde".

entries.title: Elom 20ce: 'France sold us its civilization by belittling our African cultures'
entries.description: 'From Dakar to Djibouti, a tour of the Africa-France relationship' (6/11). Togolese recording artist Elom 20ce recalls a relationship with France forged in trauma – and calls on Africans to reconnect with themselves.

entries.title: In 'Copenhagen Cowboy',  Nicolas Winding Refn creates an enigmatic superheroine
entries.description: For his return home, the Danish director of 'Drive,' slashes even deeper into the vein of sacred violence.

entries.title: 'Father & Soldier', the film on the ordeals of a Senegalese fighters during the Great War
entries.description: In his new film with Omar Sy, Mathieu Vadepied cleverly combines the historical issue of colonial violence with an intimate family story.

entries.title: Paris court set to try duo for foiled attack prior to 2017 presidential election
entries.description: The main defendant speaks several languages and is no stranger to hiding out as he posed as a Chechen for years before being arrested in Marseille in possession of an arsenal of weapons.

entries.title: In Brussels, the 'Johnny Hallyday' exhibition reignites the fire
entries.description: An immersive exhibition, dedicated to the French singer, is attracting thousands of fans to view objects, costumes and souvenirs.

entries.title: Pollution in the Indian Ocean: 'A soup of plastics'
entries.description: Researchers examining the stomach contents of turtles and seabirds, which ingest large amounts of plastic, reveal the extent of marine pollution in this part of the ocean.

entries.title: Amazon to lay off more than 18,000 workers citing economic uncertainties
entries.description: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy confirmed some of the layoffs would be in Europe, adding that the impacted workers would be informed starting on January 18.

entries.title: In Kupiansk, teachers stand accused of collaboration during Russian occupation
entries.description: In this liberated region of eastern Ukraine, some teachers continued to give classes during the Russian administration. Unlike firemen, doctors and public service employees, they are considered 'non-essential' by the law and risk prosecution.

entries.title: Calfiornia braces for life-threatening storm
entries.description: The incoming 'bomb cyclone' could bring widspread flooding and power outages, forcing California Governor Gavin Newsom to declare a state of emergency.
